faqs.question: What is Tr.emoji?
faqs.answer: Tr.emoji is a language learning platform that uses emojis to help users learn vocabulary in a fun and engaging way.

faqs.question: How does Tr.emoji work?
faqs.answer: Tr.emoji uses mini skits and dialogues featuring emoji presenters who ask questions. Users respond by selecting appropriate emojis.

faqs.question: Why should I use emojis for my language learning?
faqs.answer: Since emojis represent a great number of universal concepts, they serve as a useful visual aid in language learning. They also let lower-level users engage with language content in a way that emphasizes an understanding of the content's meaning.

faqs.question: What categories of words can I practice?
faqs.answer: Tr.emoji offers a variety of categories including emotions, jobs, sports, actions, people, animals, plants, food, geography, countries, transportation, time, weather, clothing, sports equipment, musical instruments, stationery, household items, and religion.

faqs.question: Why isn't there a category for xyz?
faqs.answer: We will update the categories regularly as required.

faqs.question: What should I do if I can't understand the question or answer?
faqs.answer: There are a few things you can do in this situation. First, you can click 'Show Hints' in the settings menu to toggle some emoji clues about the sentence. You can also temporarily change the interface language to your native language if you're really stuck. Lastly, you can keep playing! Practice makes perfect, and you'll get the meaning eventually with repeated exposure.

faqs.question: How do I change the language of the interface?
faqs.answer: To change the language of the interface, click on the ğŸŒ icon in the top right corner of the page and select your preferred language from the dropdown menu.

faqs.question: Can I hear the presenter's words?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can. For most of the supported languages, text-to-speech is available for users to check the pronunciation of words. Simply click on the presenter's words to hear words individually, or click the presenter himself to hear the complete sentence.

faqs.question: How can I make my session more challenging?
faqs.answer: First, you can try to hide clues while playing. You can also try hiding the text and relying on the presenter's audio. If you still feel the session isn't challenging enough, maybe you're ready for more advanced language content! Why not try our advanced reading platform, ComprehenReader?

faqs.question: Why isn't my target language available in Tr.emoji?
faqs.answer: We would like to add more languages to Tr.emoji in the future. However, we need to translate the content accurately into those languages before they become available.

faqs.question: What should I do if emojis are not rendering correctly?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, emojis show up differently on some devices. If you encounter compatibility issues with emojis, try using the 'Show SVG' setting. It will render emojis as images instead. All SVG emojis are designed by OpenMoji â€“ the open-source emoji and icon project. License: CC BY-SA 4.0

faqs.question: Is there an iPhone or Android app version available for Tr.emoji?
faqs.answer: Currently, Tr.emoji is only available as a web app. However, we would like to develop mobile app versions in the future.

faqs.question: Who created Tr.emoji?
faqs.answer: Tr.emoji was created by Paul Delaquis. He is a Canadian language teacher and enthusiast currently living in Taipei, Taiwan.

faqs.question: Is Tr.emoji free to use?
faqs.answer: Yes, Tr.emoji is completely free to use. We aim to provide an accessible and enjoyable language learning experience for everyone.

faqs.question: How can I contact or support the creator?
faqs.answer: You can contact the creator at pauldelaq@gmail.com. If you want to support the project, you can do so at BuyMeACoffee.
